page.title: 05FARMING NEAR PETERSFIELD
page.content:
Most of the farms near Petersfield are about 60 acres in size. This is quite small, as we found in a news item in the TIMES newspaper recently that the average size for farms in Britain is 63 hectares.(2 1/2 acres = 1 hectare).
All the farmers grow some grass on their land, and for most of them it is their main crop. The grass is cut for hay or silage and fed to the animals. The most important animals in the area are cattle. Several of the farms produce beef. They sell their animals at the markets in Winchester or Guildford. One farmer takes his animals to Chichester market. The cattle market at Petersfield stopped during the 1960s. Dairy farming is done on a few farms, and pigs and chickens are also raised.
